meaning: She is to be worshipped through the process of Mahā- yāga (the greatest yāga/ sacrifice).Maha yaaga (greatest sacrifice, yagna) refers to the antar yāga (internal worship) of the Srichakra. In Her opinion, this is the most supreme yāga.
commentary: Everything in this creation inherently belongs to the Supreme Lord. We offer to Him what actually belongs to Him alone. Therefore, when making an offering during the puja, it is the deep mental feelings of love and offering that are most important. We should also have deep intense feeling that there is a homa bowl within us to which offerings are being made. The offerings could be on a mental plane. Then it constitutes antar yaaga (inner worship).
